screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google Photos app on a mobile device. It displays the "No photos" message, indicating there are no photos currently in the app. The "Back up & sync" settings are visible, with options to upload photos in high quality (free unlimited storage) and only over Wi-Fi. The account information for "Ellie Brennan" is shown, with an option to confirm settings or change them.
action_think: The current screen shows that no photos are present in the Google Photos app, and the user wants to see their creations. It seems the user has not uploaded any photos yet or they are not visible in the app. The 'Back up & sync' settings are visible, indicating the app is ready to back up photos. The next logical action is to confirm the settings to enable the backup, or to check for any photos already in the app. Since there is a 'Confirm' button visible, I will proceed with that action to confirm the current settings.
action_plan: Click the 'Confirm' button to finalize the settings and ensure that photos can be backed up or accessed.
action_desc: Click the 'Confirm' button to finalize the settings and ensure that photos can be backed up or accessed.
action_result:
By clicking on the "Confirm" button, the backup and sync settings were finalized in Google Photos. As a result, Google Photos is now set to sync photos and videos from the user's account. 

The current screenshot shows the "No photos" message, indicating that there are no photos yet available in the app. This suggests that no photos have been uploaded or synced yet.

The action of confirming the sync settings is a necessary step for enabling photo uploads, but it hasn't yet resulted in any visible photos in the app, meaning no progress has been made towards the user's request of seeing saved creations. Further action, such as uploading photos or taking a picture, is required to see the photos in Google Photos.
prev_action_result:

Although the Photos app has opened, it does not show any of the user's saved creations yet, so the user has not yet seen their saved photos.
